trans-unit.source: Play the opening and ending themes using your Apple Music subscription.
trans-unit.note: Privacy - Media Library Usage Description

trans-unit.source: Save your favorite anime posters straight to your photo library.
trans-unit.note: Privacy - Photo Library Additions Usage Description
A text showing the current date in the format "DD/MM".
A button that opens a link to an external service related to the anime. The argument is the name of the service.
A text label displaying only the season and year of an anime.

A text displaying the season and year of an anime, optionally including its current status. The first argument is the capitalized season name. The second argument is the year the anime aired. The third argument is the anime's current status, formatted as a title.
A text displaying the airing time of an anime episode
A text displaying the airing time of an anime on
A button that allows the user to select a score for a manga. The label of the button contains the score value followed by a space and the corresponding Japanese title of the score.
Text displayed below the main title, showing the average score of the anime, along with the number of users who have rated it.
The mean score of a manga, along with the number of users who rated it.
A label displaying the number of days a user has been watching anime. The argument is the number of days. The argument is the string “%.1f”.
The secondary header info for an anime that is a TV show, OVA, or ONA. The first argument is the number of episodes. The second argument is the average episode duration.
A label displaying the number of items in the currently selected list.
The string that describes the average episode duration of an anime series.
The season and year of an anime. The first argument is the season of the anime. The second argument is the year of the anime.
A label displaying the number of chapters read out of the total number of chapters. The first argument is the number of chapters read. The second argument is the total number of chapters.
Text that appears below the main title in the details view, describing a TV show with an unknown number of episodes and a single episode duration. The argument is the episode duration.
A picker option showing a score and its corresponding title. The first argument is the score as a string of digits. The second argument is the score title.
The title of the view, showing the user's name followed by "List".
A string that combines the localized day of the week and the start time of a broadcast, formatted to include the time zone (JST).
A label displaying the user's current score for an anime. The argument is the user's score as a number out of 10.
A sublabel within the stepper that shows the number of episodes watched, followed by a slash and a question mark.
A label displaying the number of anime in a user's anime list. The argument is the count of anime in the list.
A label displaying the number of manga in a user's list. The argument is the number of manga in the list.
A label indicating the number of favorites a character has. The argument is the number of favorites.
A label showing the current episode count out of the total episode count for an anime. The first argument is the current episode count. The second argument is the total episode count.
A string describing the number of users who have listed this item. The argument is the number of users.
A view displaying the number of episodes a user has watched out of the total number of episodes for an anime.
